website_summaries.verdict: For a soft-shelled case,this product provides you with the most protection for the price.
pros: For a soft-shell gig bag, this model features an exceptional level of padding in both front and back, with a very nice cloth interior that will be very gentle on your paint job
Zippers and stitching are very durable
And it has huge pockets everywhere
cons: Cannot compete with the protection of a hard shell guitar case
Also, if your instrument is not made within traditional specifications, it may be a difficult fit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gig Bag for My Epiphone DR-100
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Epiphone DR-100 perfectly. I was a bit worried based on the reviews, but I love this gig bag. The free strap (cheap) and the picks were included. The bag fits very well, and has room for my large pool noodle "neck protector" hack. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Great in Expensive Guitar Case!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guitar teacher with several students over the years. I always have them buy an inexpensive guitar, those do not come with cases. I ordered this case to see how good it is. It meets all expectations! Great quality gig bag for an acoustic guitar. They have many cases for different needs. I highly recommend this to all my students and anyone that needs a good protective gig bag for their guitar. On a plus side, it comes with picks and a strap also. It's padded and has shoulder straps making it easy for the student to carry! More bang for the buck! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Need to work on tracking....ITEM = 5 STARS
customer_reviews.text: ONLY COMPLAINT...TRACKING PACKAGE. Could not track when it went from UPS to USPS...not good with so much package thefts happening. Seller did respond quickly. PRODUCTS -5 stars...GIG BAG- good, durable, quality material, roomy interior, lots of roomy pockets, smooth zippers, sturdy handle on side & adjustable backpack style straps. STRAP- Plain black adjustable, can draw designs on it. PICK ASSORTMENT- great for beginners like me, who don't know yet which thickness is most comfortable. GREAT PRODUCTS AT A GREAT PRICE. WILL CHECK W/This vendor before any others on any future musical instrumental needs. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: MEE MEE

customer_reviews.title: The Best Deal Ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a gig bag, and you don't buy this one, you got screwed! This is hands down the best gig bag, I've ever seen! It easily fit my Takamine G Series 12 String dreadnaught, and that is a big guitar! It has lots of pockets to carry stuff in like music and lyrics, even a folding guitar stand! They also offer a free set of picks and strap, but they are just incidental. This would be the best deal even without the freebees! I probably will never use the strap or any of the picks, I'll just give them away. The best part about it is that it only costs $25! Buy it for God's sake!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Oxford

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the last gig bag you'll ever need.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5-string BC Rich Widow bass and it's phenomenal. You can fit so much stuff in the compartments it's ridiculous. I took my home recording stuff with me on vacation recently and this stowed my MIDI keyboard and audio interface with room to spare. It's a gig bag so I wouldn't risk dropping it or anything, but the rubber fenders on the corners are very reassuring against all the bumps against things that inevitably happen. Can't believe they're making money off of it at this price. If you've got a pointy guitar or bass and can't find or afford a hard case that will fit it, then you need this. It will solve all your problems.
customer_reviews.author: TQKimber

customer_reviews.title: Stains
customer_reviews.text: The dye used for the case stained the tone knobs and my white strap.
customer_reviews.author: sara._.mari

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations. As nice as any that cost much more.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return it as the guitar I bought was shipped in its own bag. Once I opened it, I realized this was perfect for keeping my guitar protected at home and I could repurpose the other one (a Fender bag) for a new guitar in the near future. As a bonus it comes with a serviceable guitar strap and a nice assortment of picks. Plenty of pockets and the padding seems adequate. There's also a velcro strap for keeping the neck from shifting around and a well-placed piece of durable fabric around the bridge area.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fries

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality purchase
customer_reviews.text: Initally the bag seemed well made and enough cushion to carry around my guitar, not to mention multiple pockets to organize all my stuff. Then I used the bag for a couple guitar lessons and the 1st zipper broke off, so I was stuck using the 2nd zipper to go all the way around to zip up the guitar. After a few more lessons , the other zipper completely broke off and the zipper itself broke in half. The zipper on this was just terrible quality and hard to zip. The bag is unusable since it can't even hold my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Sakura

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pockets, reminds me of old school gig bags
customer_reviews.text: Today's gig bags are cheap nylon crap, this bag reminds me of the heavier materials you used to see on gig bags of the 90s. It has lots of little pockets for storing stuff inside and out, plus hands and straps all over so you can hang it or carry it anyway you like. I needed an odd-sized bag for a smaller acoustic-electric, and this baby did the job. The item also came with a product catalog that had a bunch of burnt-out looking heavy metal endorsees, and this gave me quite a few laughs. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect fit and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this guitar case for my grandson. The quality is great. No more catching zippers. The guitar is secure inside with a velcro strap. There is a place for everything in this case. The only con has been that the lesson book doesn't quite fit in the large compartment on the outside, but you could easily just place music and such on the inside if that is a problem. We just let the book hang out the top and it hasn't fallen out. Their customer service is great also!
customer_reviews.author: DanaDae

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: good product especially for the money. It's as good a soft case as any. Get a hard case if you want it to be bullet proof. One thing is it smells strongly of poly chemicals but I aired it out open outside for a couple of days and smell is gone. Now it is perfect. Would highly recommend and would buy again. Long enough for any bass guitar. Plenty of storage pockets to carry extra stuff like cables, strings, song books etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dibren

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: The bag definitely doesn't have as thick of padding as some of the more expensive gig bags out there, but for the price this one isn't bad at all. It easily fit my Yamaha FG700 which I would consider a standard full size acoustic. The quality of stitching looks good and there's plenty of large pockets. It has padded straps to carry it like a backpack, but the padding is quite thin and probably not something I'd use for a long haul. All in all I'm pleased with the bag and for the price, it's a remarkable deal.
customer_reviews.author: David Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive basic guitar protection
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bag to keep a guitar safe in storage at my house. This does the trick. I wouldn't try to tour with it but if you need a medium protection bag with storage for pics, strap, etc, you'd be hard pressed to find a better gig bag for $20. I would recommend this to anyone taking guitar to practice or small trips. Would not be suitable for preventing real damage. Cosmetic protection and convenience. Again, for $20 in happy. Zippers are solid, bag is stitched well and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Next to a hard case, this is the best thing you can do for your guitar!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bag for a brand new Fender acoustic guitar that came with a "gig bag" if you could call it that. This bag has ample padding on all sides, offers tons of pockets -one is even large enough for a small stand for the guitar or for a music stand. Also, the 2 straps for carrying your guitar "back pack" style are perfect and padded. I was surprised at the stabilizing strap on the inside for the neck of the guitar, so it doesn't get tossed to and fro in transport! Next to a hard case, this is the best thing you can do for your guitar!
customer_reviews.author: Xerran

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am too cheap to buy a hard case yet, so I was looking for a reliable soft case that I could count on. The cheap soft case that orginally came with my guitar ripped like paper, so I was a little worried. The material of this case is strong and thick, and the zippers are also of good quality. There are so many pockets, its almost possible to lose track of your things, but that isn't a bad thing at all. I don't use the guitar strap or picks, but it was a nice compliment.
customer_reviews.author: j. hickey

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace the strap D rings.
customer_reviews.text: They case is OK. Byt I found the D ring attachments that hold the shoulder straps to the bottom of the bag are subject to bending out of alignment and the straps starting to come out at the joint even, with just the guitar in the bag. Replaced both D rings with heftier ones I picked up at Lowes and they are holding up better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best in Class
customer_reviews.text: It's not easy to find a good quality gig bag that's affordable and provides good protection, but this ChromaCast bag definitely fills the bill. It has decent padding, lots of storage and fits a number of guitars: strat, tele, sg, even a 339, etc. You have to spend at least twice as much to get half of what get with this bag. A real bargain.
customer_reviews.author: E. Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space and padding
customer_reviews.text: Amazon cannot keep up with their prime commitment.This took a week to get it delivered.The polka dot v fits nicely.The head stock tip is right at the edge of the bag but,there is about one inch of padding and the hard rubber protection.I would still be careful when transporting your instrument.Plenty of padding for the back and top of an instrument.Lots of storage for books,cables,etc.
customer_reviews.author: TolaznepS

customer_reviews.title: Good gig bag at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The ChromaCast electric guitar bag is nice product at a nice price. It fits and protects my guitar (a Les Paul-shaped guitar) very well. The bonus strap and picks were a welcome addition to the order too. I have already bought another ChromaCast bag--a bass guitar bag--for another, odd-shaped (BC Rich Warlock) guitar, and it is a good product too.
customer_reviews.author: JDE

customer_reviews.title: Dread naught size...!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cheap guitar that I carry around to take lessons and practice with, it’s a better guitar than most expensive ones too so I try to look after it a little, this gig bag does the job of keeping it safe and in good condition, the bag has solid construction, has padding, pockets, compartments of different sizes, very handy, you can carry it with one hand, or on your back, however you please...I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gig bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger gig bag for a jumbo 12 string guitar, and it fit this case perfectly. I'm amazed at the quality of the case for the money, seems sturdy and well made. I expect it to last a long time with normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Frontman1955

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive the PICK SAMPLER ( which was included in the Description)
customer_reviews.text: I placed an order for ChromaCast Acoustic Guitar 6-Pocket Padded Gig Bag with "Guitar Strap" and "Pick Sampler" I received the Bag and Strap but not the Pick Sampler. Could you please send it to my address or provide me a refund. Overall the Bag quality is worth the money, I'm happy with the Bag. But still waiting for the Pick sampler. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Re-labeled wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an electric guitar case, and received an acoustic guitar case, with an "electric guitar bag" sticker over the original "acoustic guitar bag" label. As I now see others have reported. I could easily fit two of my guitar in here, it's a big floppy mess. I am not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Barwell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son. He loves it and so do I. The material is durable. There are a couple of compartments to store picks, guitar materials such as cloths, oils, picks and strings. The inside zipper that mainly houses the guitar has a secure strap inside that gently secured the guitar from flopping around. Plus this gig bag comes with a complimentary magazine and picks. This was a great purchase. No regrets and inexpensive. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Roxcy25

customer_reviews.title: Great bag with everything i need!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved that this gig bag came with picks and a strap. It was perfect for me as I'm trying to get everything I need to start playing in a one stop shop. The bag is great and has 5 external pockets for everything you could possibly need to store. It is light weight and durable and I love that it also has handles on the side in addition to the straps. I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Pare

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar bag awesome deal, pics and guitar strap made the deal unbelievable price
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag on my Epiphone SG This bag was unbelievably awesome as a pat at the bottom it’s got a strap that goes around the neck to hold everything in place it offers great protection got tons of pockets on it and that you can use for just about anything you need I would definitely recommend this to anybody new in the bag it’s got a bunch of handles you can wear it like a backpack and the free stuff they give you with it is just awesome thanks chrome cast for helping me protect my guitar Without killing me on the price like all the other bags
customer_reviews.author: Joe Zangara

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zippers and now useless.
customer_reviews.text: The zippers on this bag are the CHEAPEST POSSIBLE. Both of the main zippers broke after very little use. The design of the bag is very nice. I like using it, but I am really upset because without the zippers it is useless. I either have to replace it or spend more money than I paid for the bag to get a seamstress to put in a decent zipper. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a used guitar I bought with no case. It's just the ticket. Lightweight, zippers seem to work well and lot's of pockets. I can get my collapsible guitar stand, iPad, charger, picks, straps, tuner and capo all in this case. The strap and pick assortment are a good addition to the value.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, excellent protection
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly nice guitar bag with very good padding to protect your guitar. The one thing that was surprising is the smell, it has an odd smell, like its been in storage for awhile and I put the bag outside on my deck to air it out for 2 weeks and it still has the smell but not as bad. I put a dryer sheet in it now so hopefully the unpleasant odor will go away.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a razor blade slice in case.
customer_reviews.text: The package appeared to have been opened and then resealed with clear tape. After carefully removing, I discovered a slit in the case by something like a razor blade knife. The slit was clean and straight about 2 to 2.5 inches long. I like the case but not happy about the razor blade cut.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price (Picks are NOT included)
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a pretty well made bag. So far, all the signs are decent: guitar fits, zipper works well, etc. The strap is basic, but included. The picks don't actually come with it. Not a deal breaker, but it would be nice if they delivered what they advertised. The only question is how this holds up over time...
customer_reviews.author: P.J.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty good case. For the price it is worth it. Soft inside so it won’t scratch your guitar, and enough storage for the basics. Straps on the back seem like they should have been outfitted with padding for better comfort while wearing it. Overall good buy
customer_reviews.author: OCD_1

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Good gig bag for the price. I like the padding on it. It's much thicker than other gig bags I've looked at, so I'm pleased with how this feels. It has both backpack-style shoulder straps and a side handle for carrying, whichever you prefer. The gear pockets are nice and roomy. I currently have my two method books, guitar strap, foot stool, picks, and my capo clamp with tons of room to spare. The strap is a basic black strap, good for a back up in case your favorite breaks. The picks are a good selection of colors and weights, ranging from very heavy to very light. All in all, a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guitar Case for Carrying Guitar Around Anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this case for years now and it protects my guitar very well while also making it easy to carry around anything I need for my guitar with also extra space for other stuff. The case is hasn't torn or shown any damage since I've had it either.
customer_reviews.author: Sulley

customer_reviews.title: ovation
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality bag that keeps my guitar safe from scratches and damage when travelling in our rv. plenty of pockets, god material and decent padding. I bought the jumbo size and my ovation celebrity fits in the bag just right. very happy
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: It is a soft case.
customer_reviews.text: It is a soft case, sturdy and not sturdy all at the same time. Limited storage pouches, but allows enough of the basics. Makes it easier to carry guitar to lessons and around town with back pack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McCrary

customer_reviews.title: Arrived 2 days early, and was better quality than expected.
customer_reviews.text: The case, or Gig-bag arrived 2 days early, which was great, so it made it for Christmas. For the price, the quality was beyond what I expected, its a really nice case. The added picks and strap, put it over the top for me. Very happy if I needed another I'd buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Morrison

customer_reviews.title: More than expected guitar case
customer_reviews.text: It looks brand new, got lots of pockets, can carry it like a back pack. Had a hard time finding the guitar strap and guitar picks that were supposed to come with the case but I did find them. They looked real new and professional. The guitar picks were a variety of colors but the case was black and the guitar strap was black. I got the guitar case real quick and in good condition. It fit my acoustic Gibson steel string guitar perfectly. I was almost afraid it would not but it did. I put my guitar strap and my guitar picks in the front pocket so I wouldn't lose them and always have them with my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Christine J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great case for budget minded.
customer_reviews.text: This case looks like a good case. Fit my guitar perfectly. The strap and the assorted picks were also a nice touch. If you can afford a hard case then this will give you some protection. The pockets are well thought and very useful. Finally the manufacturer puts in a color catalog of their products that let's you know they are serious about music!
customer_reviews.author: OgFOMK

customer_reviews.title: This Does the Trick. Yay!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's junior electric guitar. (The original case ripped apart at the zippers.) I wasn't sure if it would work because Lucy's guitar is smaller than an adults - but it sure does. It holds the guitar nicely, is padded, has padded shoulder straps and has pockets for cords, music and picks. This is great and we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy P

customer_reviews.title: Good Light Duty Guitar bag
customer_reviews.text: Works well to provide appropriate protection for our Ibanez guitar. The accessories are nice too. Not sure I'd recommend it for heavy duty travel, but appropriate to go to and from class / school and to store at home. Removed one star because I wish it did not have the "ChromaCast" brand text emblazoned so prominently on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Best deal !
customer_reviews.text: I like this guitar(gig) bag. Fits all my electric guitars (individually) for car travel & walking. Has backpack straps on the backside. About ten assorted picks & a lightweight guitar strap included. Works as expected !
customer_reviews.author: studpuppie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Combo Pack for new guitarist
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice simple bag. It's nothing that will give serious protection but if you just need something lightweight to move around the bag is great. The strap is nice and easy to adjust as well. I also liked the variety of picks. I'm new to guitar so I like being able to hold and feel differently weighted picks.
customer_reviews.author: K Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed in the acoustic version of this bag. I bought a base bag for my fiance a year ago and it was great. However the description on this says it's 10 mil padding. However I've got four bags that are 10 mil padding and there's no way that this one is 10 mil. It may be 3 mil padding at best.
customer_reviews.author: amy g.

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Guitar Case
customer_reviews.text: My son got a guitar for his birthday then used some of his birthday money to purchase this case. It is a really nice case that fits his guitar perfectly. I'm really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorMama

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more money for something more durable
customer_reviews.text: The padding/fabric on this bag is of decent quality for the price, but the zippers are really thing and fragile. The first zipper snapped off like a piece of plastic while I was pulling on it within a few weeks of getting the bag. It's been sitting in my closet for a couple years, mostly untouched, and I went to use it to transport a guitar today and the second zipper snapped right off, rendering the thing pretty much useless unless. I'd recommend coughing up a few extra bucks for a higher quality/name brand bag with burlier zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Lucian Go

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made bag that has tons of storage. It is an amazing price and value. I really appreciate the spare strap and the picks. They are also really good. Thank you for making this product, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles LaDuca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Toting My Son's Guitar Back and Forth From School
customer_reviews.text: My son is taking guitar in high school and is responsible for bringing his guitar back and forth from school. This guitar bag fits perfect, is so reasonably priced, lightweight and has a comfortable long carrying strap. It also has pockets for any accessories, like his tuner. It's also perfect for protecting his guitar and keeping it from getting dusty or scratched. It's nothing fancy, but it's held up extremely well so far and seems like it will last for years to come. It's exactly what we needed at an affordable price. I totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gig bag for me.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is just what I needed - I don't take my acoustic guitar out of the house very often so I just needed something to keep it safe at home and easy and light to tote the guitar and the few accessories I have to a performance. It's sturdy, well padded, has more than enough pockets for storage.
customer_reviews.author: MarineMa

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: My 5th grader is starting band this year and needed a way to transport his guitar to school. So far so good. I am affraid of it breaking because its not a hard case and he is only 10. But this was easier for him to carrily it to school. Back pack style
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This bag is lightweight and offers a little protection to the guitar. The pockets in front are good to store picks, capo, or anything small. I bought this instead of a hard case because of the price, but I would rather have the hard case instead since it protects the guitar better. This is good if you don’t want to spend too much on a case.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal For Inexpensive Storage
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well made soft case. Nice stitching, decent padding, zippers and pockets. Only minus is that it was folded in 3 into a too small box and I had to hang it with weights in it to get the creases out, but it will serve the purpose I need. Probably not for gigging or air travel.
customer_reviews.author: A.D. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Already broke
customer_reviews.text: The straps to put on your back have already broke and I've only had it a few months. The metal they used for the straps to connect to the bag is really weak and bends, making it easy to slip off while you're wearing it on your back. So be careful not to break your instrument! But there are still so many other places to hold it from, so it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Tele

customer_reviews.title: A Snug Fit but a really good budget bag...
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag, although it is a snug as can be fit for a 41 inch dreadnought sized guitar, its pretty sturdy and the shoulder straps are ample, not skimpy...but the price was around 20.00 so I cant complain about it....padded, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Guitar Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome, it has lots of padding, plenty of pockets & 3 ways to carry it. The strap fit on my daughters electric guitar great. I would recommend this bag to anyone looking for a lightweight bag to carry their guitar around daily. My daughter used it to take her guitar to school for guitar class.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded

customer_reviews.title: i do not like this bag
customer_reviews.text: i do not like this bag, it rips apart easily, this is poorly crafted. I do not suggest this bag for anyone, unless you are using it to carry around papers...but don't use it to carry around a guitar...some of the pics were flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Jayfer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Padded Gig Bag For Smaller Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Super nice bag. Perfectly padded to protect my guitar. I have a parlor size acoustic guitar and it is a perfect fit. The included guitar strap is cheap, stiff, and difficult to adjust. If you are looking for a guitar bag, I’d definitely recommend this one. However, I’d pick up a separate strap that’s a little nicer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wellmeier

customer_reviews.title: Solid gig bag with lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: This gig bag is such a great deal! For less than $20 you get a nice looking, sturdy, well made and versatile gig bag. There's lots of pockets and thick padding to protect your guitar. Plus it has a durable handle and 2 straps for carrying. It fits several styles of electric guitar so I'll be buying more for future guitar purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: good number of pockets and comfortable to carry
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is decent, good number of pockets and comfortable to carry. Unfortunately the D rings used on the straps are weak, and one strap completely came undone after very light use (3 lessons a few blocks from home) so mine is duct taped. Still functional, and maybe I just got a wonky bag or a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Beck

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTHTHE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: for the price this bag is worth it I have a capo tuner bag of picks my 12 string oscar acustic it fit fine, some music books that are 8 and a half by 11 if longer roll then up and put them in the neck pocket. the strap is ok and the pick were good for the price a good bag to practice with at the park or to go to lessons and house storage that all it for zippers were fine on mine .I hope everyone get the same quality i got
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this case to protect my expensive full size classical guitar. The padding is thick, large heavy duty zippers, many large storage compartments and carrying straps for every need. I recommend this gig bag to all needing protection for their equipment at home and during careful transportation. It's not a hard case but it's perfectly priced and well made.
customer_reviews.author: bobj401

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...
customer_reviews.text: No issues thus far so I can't complain. The package arrived sooner than expected, everything was there and in good condition. Everything is just as it should be and it does not have a "cheap" feel. Functions exactly the way it is intended to. Only complaint I guess I *could* have is that the package said the name of the product right on it and it was a Christmas present to go with a new guitar, good thing my sister wasn't home to see it at the time. I would recommend this product, though.
customer_reviews.author: Karli

customer_reviews.title: Nice padding and love the pockets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend and had it embroidered with her tag name. She LOVED it! So many pockets to put everything you need even a guitar stand! Nice and padded thick for protection. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lee

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said, great for the $$.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive bag for an inexpensive guitar (Squier Bullet Mustang). Bought this after returning another cheap bag priced similarly. This one is so much better. Durable material, nicely put together, and with lots of extra storage. I've paid twice what this bag cost for gig bags not really any nicer. I rarely take my guitars out of the house, but if I did, I would not hesitate to transport one in this bag, at least for light-duty travel. It's a gig bag costing less than 25 bucks, and for that, it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this over a year and it’s still holding up well. It’s way better than the case that came with the guitar we bought. It’s for a beginner, it’s been working well.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag with 6 Pockets
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit for the money, at $28. The strap is trash but the case is as described. There are 6 pockets in addition to the main compartment. Side handles and back straps. There are two pockets along the neck and four pockets on the body of this gig bag. The neck pocket accommodates my portable stand. The main zipper is well position along the edge of the top cover. This lets the bulk of the guitar sit protected in the bag when opened.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: It FIt's My Squier Stratocaster Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well constructed and has several pockets for stuff. Good price, nice appearance, fits my guitar like a custom bag. What more could be needed? Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: We got my niece a guitar for her birthday and wanted to get something relatively inexpensive to protect it. This fit the bill perfectly! It is very nicely padded, has lots of compartments and was a perfect fit for the guitar we bought. I loved that it has a carrying handle as well as backpack straps so she can carry it either way. The set of picks and the guitar strap are an added bonus. Great value for what we received! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Erin L

customer_reviews.title: Great gig case!
customer_reviews.text: This case holds everything needed and in convenient spots, too. It seems to be pretty well made considering how inexpensive it really is, a brand name guitar center is asking almost four times the price for a less well made item that doesn't come with the extras. It shipped quickly even though it's the silly season. I would recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners set!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginners kit and even better price. We did have to buy a replacement amp cord as the one with the kit wasn’t working too well. But considering total value on this, this was an excellent purchase
customer_reviews.author: R - Williamsburg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or your time
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, thin case. Don't waste your money or your time. Looks for something with a little more padding, better zippers, and bigger pockets. The large pocket on this bag isn't large enough to hold a music book or a folder that you might need to carry for lessons or a gig.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Champagne

customer_reviews.title: protects guitar well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transport my son's guitar back and forth to practice. Very well padded. I think you could treat this pretty rough and the guitar would be fine. Good design.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Durable enough, slumpy structure
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be durable enough and has some extra storage pockets. Only complaint is that it requires the guitar to be in it so keep it's structure. Not sure if it will eventually fix itself as it was rolled into a tight ball for shipping so that could be the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for any acoustic
customer_reviews.text: i use this case for my ibanez acoustic and it works great! Also works well with my epiphone acoustic so no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Irish_Pickle

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Bag Received
customer_reviews.text: So this gig bag is great for the money. I really like the pic sampler. I’m new at playing guitar so it was nice to use different ones. The strap works well and there are plenty of pockets on this bag. I unfortunately can’t rate full stars because they sent the wrong size...? If you are able to zoom on the pic, the bag size on the label says “acoustic” when I ordered electric. I checked back on my order and the mistake was not on my part. I was really excited to get the bag (it arrived 1 day before my new guitar)... but the bag is just too big to use with it. Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Musician

customer_reviews.title: great guitar case
customer_reviews.text: The guitar case that came with my child's guitar was aweful, all of the zippers broke within a week. This guitar case is very sturdy and padded in all the all the right places so I feel confident her guitar is protected. It has many pockets to hold her sheet music, music stand, pics, strings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good. I just needed a bag to carry my guitar on a trip and I had low expectations for this case. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cortese

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case for the money!
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this case for 3 yrs now and it's just as nice today as the day we bought it! Never a problem! Sturdy, well made.
customer_reviews.author: IMJC

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality - Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This guitar bag has plenty of storage, is well padded, and lots like it would hold up to much abuse. The choice of this item will not be regretted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good bag. but.... the handles and back pack straps could have been placed differently for easier carrying. Again, good bag but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Protects well and fits many styles of bass guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th gig bag from this company. It fits my Basses as advertised. And I have many different sizes and shapes of bass guitars.
customer_reviews.author: RT SLINGER

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great bag for price.
customer_reviews.text: I want to give it 5 stars because it is what it says- a good priced carrier. But, it has an element of "cheap" to the label part, so I had to give it 4. It works, my daughter loves it and you cannot beat the price. Def. worth it! I just have a hard time knowing when to give a 5 star or 4. I mean, it is not a 500.00 bag, so if it was, it would get a 1 or 2, but it is really nice for price and solid and she keeps her stuffed animal hanging out the back.
customer_reviews.author: Taking Action!

customer_reviews.title: Fits 3/4 Acoustic Guitar perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This ChromaCast guitar case and kit fits a 3/4" guitar perfectly. It has plenty of extra pockets for picks, lesson books, small guitar stand and other exta things needed to get our kid back and forth to lessons. This is the case to get for that. Protects well and has plenty of storage. We've had it for around 8 months now and it has held up well. Good quality and great price.
customer_reviews.author: FG

customer_reviews.title: Two strikes, you're out!
customer_reviews.text: The first bag arrived and I attempted to open it and the zipper tab just pulled off the zipper. It was obviously a flaw, that can happen; so I sent it back and asked for a new bag. The new bag arrived and my Yamaha acoustic guitar with a 4" body wouldn't fit in the bag. It was obviously not a 6" bag as described. It may have just been a packaging or a shipping mistake but I gave up and will look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Millman

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar case
customer_reviews.text: I bought the guitar case for my son for his acustic guitar, plenty of storage with the pockets in the from.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This guitar case is perfect. The padding, the multiple zipper storage compartments, the backpack and hand carrying handles, the rubber padding on the bottom. Came with a free strap and picks. I bought the 3/4 size for my child's guitar and it fits great.
customer_reviews.author: gabriella

customer_reviews.title: so this will work perfect for the bed of the pickup
customer_reviews.text: Killer bag for the price. I was sold on the pocket for a guitar stand. I've yet to use much, but looks solid. Lots of pockets and enough protection for most uses. We drive to the coast every other weekend, so this will work perfect for the bed of the pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Coastwx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed and it has so many pockets and zippers, you get confused, but used to them. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Cerrato

customer_reviews.title: Well made, strong.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with how heavy the material is. Seems to be well made and strong. Padding could be thicker but is good enough. I got the Acoustic Guitar gig bag for a Ibanez aeg 12 string it fits well. For anyone wondering how deep it is, see pics. I put my 1975 Applause/Ovation oval back guitar in it and it is NOT tight. Fits good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Greer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST $25 YOU'LL SPEND...
customer_reviews.text: For $25 it is absolutely impossible to beat this deal. As long as your guitar fits (My guitar is 43" and fits nicely) and you're not looking for a shell type case, this gig bag is perfect. It's a heavy duty material with heavy duty zippers. Good balance when holding it by either handle and very comfortable when wearing the shoulder straps. It does come with a guitar strap but only 4 picks, not the 12 shown in the picture. But even if it came with nothing, this is still the best $25 you're going to spend. . . I'm very happy with this purchase. And, as usual with Amazon, it arrived almost before I finished ordering.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my bf and he liked it. It gets the job done and he really liked that it has the backpack straps as he sometimes likes to walk to work with his guitar. Only issue has been that the metal piece that holds the strap at the bottom bent a little and the strap slipped off but I'm thinking that's his fault.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Product is better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many reviews -good and bad, I was more or less convinced that this was the bag I needed for my Fender Sonoran acoustic guitar. Well, I received the product a few days ago and I'm happy to report that product met dimensional and functional expectations. The quality of the materials on this bag is good for the price paid and the functionality is enhanced by its many pockets and straps to carry the bag as a backpack. Cushion is not the very best but appears to be sufficient to protect my instrument on those occasional trips to guitar class. It was great that it arrived with extra picks and a strap. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: hernanan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gig bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best gig bag I've ever used or seen. If you compare it to a hard case, you're gonna have a bad time. It's not a hard case, nor will it ever be. What it IS is a very well built gig bag with a decent amount of padding and plenty of pockets. The only part that I think could be better would be the backpack straps, they fill a little flimsy. The carry handle is great, though.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Marie Bathory

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy, amazing case. There’s tons of storage. You can easily transport your guitar, music, and extras all on your back! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice very happy
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a glove. Beautiful item, nice graduation gift. Very well received. Plus extra picks was a nice touch. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Corina

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag imho, I’ve had it for nearly a year now and it’s still in good shape! I took it camping and woke up wet, the due was obviously super heavy! So I run to my guitar to check on everything to find it dry as a bone and still sounding beautiful! The only problem I’ve had is one of the shoulder straps came off it’s hook but with a little craftsmanship it was good as new! And I mean cmon it was $20 you can’t beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Ti M

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these so far and there are plenty of pockets to store your capo, extra strings, harmonica, I-pad, music books ect... I don't do any hardcore traveling with my guitars, so there was no need to spend over $100 for a hard case. Another nice feature is when you are not using the guitar bag, it stores nice and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G.

customer_reviews.title: Zipped pockets for music gear, but no padding for protection.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent gig bag that provides you with zipped pockets to keep your sheet music, picks, and other equipment. At the same time, I didn't think that this gig bag had enough padding to protect my guitar. In fact, it has zero padding. It isn't hard backed either, so if you're looking for a case that will give you added protection, you might want to look elsewhere, although this isn't a bad case to carry your guitar around town in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: silhouette_of_enchantment

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and fit for the money- guitar case
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this guitar case - fits my parlor guitar like a glove with lots of pockets to store things
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Strong and hold quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a bass guitar and it’s actually really nice...strong and holds quite a bit
customer_reviews.author: Zackster86

product_meta.title: GO-DPS ChromaCast Electric Guitar 6-Pocket Padded Gig Bag with Guitar Strap and Pick Sampler
product_meta.description: Color:Electric GuitarThis Electric Guitar Padded Gig Bag is ideal for transporting your valuable Guitar. Designed to protect your 6-string beauty and keep it sounding its best. Features 6-pockets, 2 shoulder straps, 2 handles, 10mm padding and rubber base bumper. Fits most standard electric guitars.
feature_bullets: ChromaCast electric Guitar padded Gig Bag
Exterior dimensions: 40" Length x 12" (Upper Bout)/ 15" (Lower bout) Width x 3" Height
Interior dimensions: 39.5" Length x 12" (Upper Bout)/ 14.5" (Lower bout) Width x 2.5" Height
Includes: ChromaCast padded Gig Bag, guitar strap, & pick Sampler

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,732 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
